instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V8_AWAKE: What is PP1V8_AWAKE? The PP1V8_AWAKE signal in the MacBook schematic is indicative of a power rail that delivers 1.8 volts when the machine is in an "awake" state. This is not a traditional power state defined in the older Intel PCH documentation; it seems to be specific to newer MacBook architectures. The "awake" designation likely refers to a state where the MacBook is on and ready for user interaction, but it is not necessarily at full operational capacity (which would be denoted by an S0 state).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Came in with liquid damage, 

Coffee was spilt into the mac before christmas! It was pretty grim when I opened it up and it had 3 or 4 real bad spots of corrosion!,

Its had a good clean and after passing through the Ultrasonic the board looks like new again, 

I get just 5v  / 0 amps on USB-meter and I am reading a dead short to ground on anything related <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL>

( doing a visual inspection I cant see anything obviously wrong but do seem to have 2 missing components RC332 / CC332 - but unsure if this is one of those where the board dose not  match the schematic but I do not have another same board to compare? )

Where to start finding this short? I'm a bit lost on these newer boards?

Thanks in advance

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
What is the exact ohm value of the short?
Check if any coil gives the same reading to ground.
If none bad, then you can use voltage injection method...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
short is measuring OL . 0.00 
No coils giving me OL

Ill try voltage injection

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: OL is not short at all; don't confuse with 0.000...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
OL would flash quickly on meter then go to 0.000

Just tried voltage injection and got nowhere, couldn't detect anything getting hot even with it pulling amps.
I think this one may be too far gone.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Use ohm scale, instead of diode mode, to measure the short.

If you really have pure short, then shouldn't have problems to find the culprit.
Set amp limit to max on the PSU first and start with 1V.
Be aware, even 1V may generate 10A (even more) into pure short.
5A PSU will not help at all.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Found that cr637 was bad, removed it and now pulling 20v and charging the battery.

Still dosent turn on. Going over power rails I'm finding pp1v8_ is all short to ground.

Not site where to go form here?

Also can't find any power on pads for this do these macs have them?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Please, specify which 1V8 power rail is shorted to ground?
Also post exact ohm value of the short.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Sorry my bad, 

<SIGNAL>PP1V8_AWAKE</SIGNAL>

Using this new meter that arrived today and its very different from my old one measures <SIGNAL>PP1V8_AWAKE</SIGNAL> = 009.5 ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
You should compare with good board.

Can you put the machine in DFU mode now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Its not recognized trying DFU , I do not seem to get any kind of power on state, no fan spin no trackpad. 

I dont have another same board to comapre sadly

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Compare diode mode readings (several points) with your board:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://logi.wiki/index.php/M1_MacBooks#CPU.2FDRAM.2FNAND_Resistance_to_ground_.<SIGNAL>28MACBOOK_PRO_2020_M1_820</SIGNAL>-02020.29[/URL]
